newsitem.title: UK: Tarmac sees savings after hefty charges.
newsitem.headline: Tarmac sees savings after hefty charges.

text.p: British construction group Tarmac Plc saw its first half results plunge into loss on Tuesday after a 65 million pound ($101 million) charge relating to an asset swap with Wimpey Plc earlier this year.
But it said the restructuring would result in cost savings of 35 million pounds a year, higher than original estimates. ($1=.6435 Pound)
Tarmac reported a pretax loss of 58.3 million pounds for the six months to June 30 versus a 15.9 million loss, after accounting for the one-off charge.
An asset swap earlier this year saw Tarmac acquire Wimpey's aggregates and construciton unit.
Stripping out that factor, underlying pretax profits were 6.7 million pounds -- at the bottom end of forecasts -- versus 29.1 million.
The dividend was frozen at three pence per share.
